gw.api.util

Class Ratio

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • gw.api.util.Ratio
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Ratio>

    public class Ratio
extends java.lang.Number
implements java.lang.Comparable<Ratio>
    Represents a ratio of two numbers, i.e., a rational number. Another way to think of a ratio is as a deferred division. That is, calculations can be made with ratios, with no loss of accuracy until the ratio is realized as a BigDecimal via the resolve(int, RoundingMode) method.

    Most of the Ratio methods operate on instances of Number. The implementation handles all the implementations of Number defined in java.lang and java.math, as well as Ratio itself, of course. Ratios are represented internally with BigIntegers, so all arguments of type Number are eventually converted into pairs of BigInteger. Conversions happen in the following way:

    • java.math.BigInteger - no conversion necessary
    • Integeral types (java.lang.Long, java.lang.Integer, etc.) - converts to BigInteger via BigInteger.valueOf(number.longValue())
    • java.math.BigDecimal - the numerator comes from the unscaled value, and the denominator is 10^scale of the BigDecimal.
    • Floating point types (java.lang.Double, java.lang.Float) - converted into a String, and then into a BigDecimal, then converted as a BigDecimal. Double.NaN, Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, and Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY are not allowed. See the Javadoc for java.math.BigDecimal(String) for further explanation.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
